sentences: The agreed text for this section notes evidence of recent warming, including increases in temperatures, widespread melting of snow and ice, and rising global mean sea level.
It indicates that eleven of the last twelve years (1995-2006) rank among the 12 warmest years recorded since 1850.

It also includes a table on recent and projected trends and human contribution to them for various phenomena and extreme weather events, including increases in heat waves, droughts, heavy precipitation events, tropical cyclone activity, and incidence of extreme high sea level.
enb_long_title: Tenth Session of the IPCC Working Group I (WGI)
